intro: Spennera annua, commonly known as the annual spennera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Spennera annua is primarily grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive blooms and ease of cultivation.
